primary_trope.name: expose
primary_trope.hook_text: Badlands has a dirty secret the brochure won't tell you.
primary_trope.mechanism: Cognitive dissonance — viewer believed X was good, specific counter-evidence triggers emotional demand for resolution.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Badlands? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Badlands scored 89 out of 100. The Icons tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Badlands. Granada, Andalusia, Spain. 497 mi. An 800km expedition through Andalusia's extremes. Desert badlands that look like Mars, Europe's only true desert, and the 3.4 thousandm Pico Veleta climb. Self-supported means you carry what you need between remote villages. The combination of distance, elevation, heat, and self-reliance is unmatched in gravel racing.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. Here's where it lands. Logistics. 5 out of 5. Best-in-class operations. Everything just works. Registration opens for exactly 5 days in November and closes at capacity - demand outstrips spots by 5:1. Length. 5 out of 5. Ultra distance. Bring lights and a plan. Brad Shenton laughed "literally out loud" when his Wahoo showed a 39km climb section. Technicality. 5 out of 5. The course is the competitor. Elevation. 5 out of 5. Mountainous. Your granny gear will earn its keep. 52,493 feet of climbing culminates at Calar Alto Observatory and the brutal Mirador. Climate. 5 out of 5. Extreme conditions guaranteed. Dress accordingly. Late August Andalusia delivers 43°C desert heat by afternoon after starting at 18°C. Altitude. 5 out of 5. Oxygen is a luxury item at this elevation. Adventure. 5 out of 5. Type-two fun guaranteed. Type-one fun optional. Chris Hall calls it "so much more than just a bike race. Prestige. 5 out of 5. The one people ask about first. Elite riders like Mattia de Marchi, Sarah Scozzaro, and James Mark Hayden validate the field depth.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Experience. 5 out of 5. Transformative. People come back different. Race Quality. 4 out of 5. High-quality event. Attention to detail shows. Community. 4 out of 5. Riders come for the race. Stay for the people. Field Depth. 4 out of 5. Stacked field. Fast riders everywhere. Value. 3 out of 5. Fair value. You get what you pay for. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Expensive. Travel and lodging add up fast.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: AGP - 90min drive; GRX - local but limited; SVQ - 2.5hr
Lodging: Granada city for pre/post race. During race: bivvy/sleeping bag as needed, occasional hotel/hostel stops for resupply and rest. Plan your sleep strategy.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: The Ultra Extreme. Yes if you have genuine ultra-endurance experience and want the ultimate test. Yes if you can handle extreme heat and self-support logistics. Skip if you haven't completed multi-day bikepacking events or can't adapt to 40°C+ conditions.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.
